website_summaries.verdict: This sturdy bath support holds active babies in place so moms don't have to. Ideal for little ones who are ready to make a splash in a full sized tub.
pros: Extendable arms with heavy-duty suction cups securely attach to any standard bathtub
High backrest provides good support for babies who are learning to sit
Allows tots to safely bathe with siblings
Affords parents hands-free bath time convenience
cons: Not recommended for babies under 5 months

customer_reviews.title: TWO CAN FIT
customer_reviews.text: So if you're like me and need to know if TWO CAN FIT IN A STANDARD TUB... they can!!!! Best buy for my twins AND if I remove ONE their older sister (2 year old) can bathe with one of them. Their feet semi touch each other but that has proven only hilarious which equals more tub time which equals more mommy relaxing time! These guys are 18lbs at 10months old if that helps!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah M Stemach

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS ITEM!!! Safety issue!
customer_reviews.text: Well the baby really enjoyed this seat but when he leaned back he pulled his leg up and it slipped through the side opening. Now he, like a lot of babies, has chubby legs and his leg was STUCK!!! We literally has to cut him out of this seat after the very first use! The seat is in the trash!! In my opinion this is a safety issue and a design flaw! P
customer_reviews.author: Trista

customer_reviews.title: Can you really bathe the baby?
customer_reviews.text: I thought this seat would help me keep my daughter safe in the tub while she wants to move around and I can wash her. She can move around and she's very safe, but it is impossible to wash her lower body. This seat is more of a just let them sit there and do their business seat than a functional bathing seat.
customer_reviews.author: Katelin

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This holds our little guy in one spot, so he doesn't try to stand up or crawl around in the tub. He was sitting pretty well just on the bathtub mat, but I like this anyway because it feels safer. Very easy to install. I didn't need to read the directions. Solid construction.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Bath Seat
customer_reviews.text: I like this product because It helps my supported sitter have place to sit during bath time. My child is getting to big for a baby tub, so I came across this. The back arm is way to long and takes up half the tub. I have another child that will also be in the tub. I decided to take off the back arm and use it like so. Now it is the perfect seat! I dont ever leave my kids alone in the tub so this will be no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Shawna

customer_reviews.title: I couldn't put my son's legs through the holes and gave up after the second try
customer_reviews.text: It looked very sturdy and very easy to install however i don't understand why there isn't a front latch that opens up so that you can easily have your baby sit on it and secure it afterwards. It was so difficult to have my 8 month old sit on this bath seat because first of all you are reaching forward very awkwardly with your baby and trying to put your baby's legs through the holes. Either i'm really stupid and couldn't figure out a simple way to do it or it simply is not a good product. I gave it a try twice and now i think it's not worth the hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Dorel Pollack

customer_reviews.title: MOLD
customer_reviews.text: I took this out of the tub every night for the three months we used it. Tonight I was bathing my children and noticed black flecks in the water. When I took the tub out after bath time, huge chunks of mold came out of the seat. It seems to have collected in the front safety bar, as there is no way to drain that fully. I put apple cider vinegar in the tub tonight to help clear diaper rash and I imagine that caused the mold to loosen and dislodge. Disgusting. I’ll be calling the manufacturer for a refund tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy Marie

customer_reviews.title: My son loves it
customer_reviews.text: It is extremely sturdy and well built. It honestly doesn't feel like it is going to slip or fall at all. Materials are high quality. The only issue I have is the seat size incredibly large and I have to stick a towel behind my son's back so he doesn't slide out. He is a very large baby so the fact even he slides around without the extra towel means the seat is just a bit too big. He will grow into it.
customer_reviews.author: Jaz T

customer_reviews.title: Very used !!!
customer_reviews.text: Wow. I don't even know what to say about this. My husband ordered " open box - brand new" and it's anything but new. It arrived disgusting and clearly used. There were even little black hairs on it. Not only that but when I thought I got it clean enough to use , little black bugs came out from it (ignore my dirty). Really hoping the company and correct this.
customer_reviews.author: kaitlin

customer_reviews.title: Feels much more safe than an open seat
customer_reviews.text: We really love using this with our daughter who is now 9 months. We of course never leave her alone in the bath, but with this seat, I can reach for toys and shampoo without my hand gripping her leg because she moves around so much! She cannot get out of it or tip over enough to put her head in the water. The plastic arms are great, keeps the seat firm in its spot. It’s a little hard to clean her lower half, so my husband takes her out and she stands up so I can wash but then we put her back in. I’ve had several people ask where we got it since I posted photos.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany L.

customer_reviews.title: great idea, but keep a lookout
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to assist my less than 1yr old son in the bath. A way for him to transition from a infant tub to a traditional tub and still get cleaned and play. This serves that purpose just fine. But, as there are no restraints on this unit (and I can understand why), my son can easily get out or get up if he wanted to. I wasn't exactly expecting him to be able to when I bought this, but be aware. Also, my 3yr old son can easily get in to this, so, an added 2yrs of age and size can fit in here. Just a size comparison for you to think about.
customer_reviews.author: JasonG

customer_reviews.title: I love this bath seat!
customer_reviews.text: I love this bath seat! it is perfect for my little guy. He can sit up on his own but not for too long before it topples over. He loves bath time and I wanted a way for him to sit up and be able to play and I can now play with him. The only thing I don't like is the back arm. With my tub, the back of the tub is so curved that the arm can't suction to it, I wish it was removable so I could shift the seat a little further back. But the side arms are perfect and work great!
customer_reviews.author: Erin B.

customer_reviews.title: Other than that I'm pleased with this product
customer_reviews.text: So convenient to give bath. I started using when my son was 4 months old. I'm not afraid of him falling or slipping out, feels so safe. It would not fit in my master bath tub, the arms were small. Had to fit it in the bath upstairs with narrower width. Other than that I'm pleased with this product. This is a unique product which is safe and convenient which you don't find anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Saloni Dhar

customer_reviews.title: That the makers of this product would consider making the front bar raise up and down with a locking element, also color choices
customer_reviews.text: I gave four stars, because my granddaughter did like to sit in, because her legs and knees would get scratched,puttingb her in and out. After the 3rd time I stop putting her in it. i like that it came on time, i didnt like that my granddaughter sca I did like that it came as expected. But as for granddaughter she, DID NOT LIKE that every time I lifed her up out her the tub, she would cry, because her legs would get scratched. Would be nice if it came different sizes and colors. Or maybe if you could lift and unlock the front bar. to place the babies in.
customer_reviews.author: Nene Flournoy

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome! My 4 month old is a chunker who no longer fits or wants to be in the laying position while in the bath but she cannot sit-up independently, this chair was perfect and has so much room for her to grow and use it yet is still efficient being a little “big” for her now. It’s hard to find baby products of any kind that “fit” longer than a few months. They grow so fast ! Couldn’t be happier with this bath seat !
customer_reviews.author: Liv

customer_reviews.title: Love the concept, but poorly made especially for male little ones
customer_reviews.text: I wanted so badly to love this because it appeared to be super convenient for my 7 month old that LOVES bath time, but he just hates it :( The suction power is great and definitely keeps child safely secure in the bath. But the space between the child and the backing of the seat is such an awkward length and not adjustable, so my little one was just slipping and sliding. I also noticed that his little private area would get smashed in the front where the hole to put the leg is. It is also impossible to wash the bottom part of him, which kind of defeats the purpose of having a bathing device
customer_reviews.author: Treydan’s Mommy ♥️

customer_reviews.title: NECESSITY FOR BABIES!!
customer_reviews.text: We got this as soon as our son started trying to roll over in the bathtub on his previous seat! Makes our life so much easier- even though he can sit up he’s still a baby and clumsy so I like the reassurance that this will keep him safer and upright. I read reviews that people had issues cleaning their kid through the seat but I don’t find it to be difficult. No matter what way you look at it your kid is sitting down in the bath hahaa and so you do what you can to make sure you get them clean. I recommend to all my friends that have kids and they love it too!
customer_reviews.author: Taylor D. Atwood

customer_reviews.title: When are you supposed to use it exactly???
customer_reviews.text: This bath seat is great in theory. It was gotten for my 6 month old. I could barely get her in and out of it because the leg hole size and the fact that it doesn't open for seating. Used it 3 times and now it's collecting dust. Not really worth the price tag when compared to how long it can actually be used. Babies that can't sit assisted can't use it but as soon as they're big enough they don't really fit. Kind of bummed. Lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle S

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy it unless you’ve got a short baby
customer_reviews.text: Returned it. My baby must be too tall for this bath seat (he is 6.5 months, but in the 97th percentile for height). He couldn’t sit in it. Like we couldn’t even get his legs in it, because of how short (opposed to long) the seat is. Bub is in 12 month pants, so I guess for a normal sized baby this would work fine. But I doubt baby would fit if it’s older than 10ish months.
customer_reviews.author: C&M

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Bath Seat
customer_reviews.text: This is so convenient. It helps for children who can sit up but have a tendency to still tip over. It keeps them safely in a seated position so you don't have to worry about catching them if they start to tip while you're bathing them. It's extremely secure and durable. It's easy to clean. It's a little difficult to store, but it's worth it for how much you'll use it. You'll know when your child is too big because it will become more difficult to get them in and out because there is no give at all due to the sturdiness. Obviously never leave your child unattended while using this, but it's a huge help for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Good for babys who sit up
customer_reviews.text: My little one loves this bath chair since she can sit up now. It should be good for her until shes at least a year old, or out grows it-love baby equipment that lasts longer than a few months! It suctions good to the sides and back so it won't slip or move anywhere during bathtime. It is kind of bulky to take in and out when I have to shower myself, and kind of big to store in the closet. But overall definitely worth it! I searched for similar products and this was one of the few I found, I would recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Kassi

customer_reviews.title: Definitely SAFE!
customer_reviews.text: I used bath rings for both of my babies once they transitioned into the big tub and wanted one for my granddaughter. Good luck trying to find one!! Apparently they were deemed a drowning hazard so they stopped making them. Sorry but it's not the product, it's the parents. After searching forever I found this one and boy is it SAFE!! Once this thing is installed it won't move, perfect for a slippery baby! Never leave babies unattended in the bath but at least you can let go to grab the soap!
customer_reviews.author: Ruth

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: We needed safer way to give our 1 year old a bath... out grew the baby tub pretty quickly. This seat is perfect but I took off 1 star because it was covered in safety/warning labels! Similar labels were on our baby tub, and they eventually peel and end up in the bath water so it took a while to scrape them all off with a razor blade. That probably seems like a odd thing to complain about but I expected it to look like the picture when I removed it from the box, and it was covered in huge warning labels. 😕
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: Good, But not for high-energy babies that can stand
customer_reviews.text: Lol my just-turned 9 month old got out of this in 2 seconds, defeating (most of) its purpose. Thought about returning but at least I know he has a stable place to sit when hes not getting out of it. I think its age appropriate for babies that have a long period between sitting unassisted & standing. My baby crawled, sat, stood, & walked assisted within 2 months time. If this is your baby especially if also is high energy, this bath seat wont be quite as worry free as you too imagined. Still keeping it, but doesnt provide the lower stress bath experience I thought it would by other reviews.
customer_reviews.author: JenM

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to love it
customer_reviews.text: I really really wanted to love this bath seat, especially considering my baby boy LOVES showers and I wanted to be able to sit him in a secure seat while I showered rather than in his bouncer on the floor outside of the shower. This seat is a great idea, but it doesn't work well in my standard bathtub. Not only that, it isn't the most comfortable of bath seats, and my baby boy absolutely hates it. We used it once, and he cried the entire time he sat in it.
customer_reviews.author: SKidwell

customer_reviews.title: Overall good seat for bath time
customer_reviews.text: So i was skeptical about this.. but i bought it and i kinda like it. The only dislikes i have are; the back suction does not suction at all but the side ones are really freaking good that you don’t really need the back one to suction. And the other dislike i have is that my baby is chunky and it’s not really difficult to get him out of the seat but i have to grab him by putting one hand on his chest and underarms and my other hand on his butt to lift him out at an angle. I think they should design it to lift up in the front as a latch.
customer_reviews.author: Kaylee t

customer_reviews.title: Poorly designed!
customer_reviews.text: It does take a lot of space in the bath, which is problematic if you have multiple kids and want to save time and water by bathing them together. My main disappointment was that it was extremely difficult to get my 4.5 month old out of this seat. His legs would get stuck due to little room to scoop him back and remove him from the seat upwards (not sure how to properly describe this). The leg holes do not open, so if your child get stuck you will spend a lot of time trying to get him out. Not a pleasant experience for us.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great seat!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. Our 6 month old outgrew her angelcare bath seat and needed something more secure. This seat is perfect as she can sit up and hold the bar in front, there’s a little wiggle room but not enough to slump over in. Finally I can bathe her without having to hold her from jumping ship with one hand and trying to actually accomplish washing her with the other. The suction cups are strong, I have zero concern about it tipping or coming loose.
customer_reviews.author: Peahen

customer_reviews.title: Great product , saved alot of Hassell in the tub
customer_reviews.text: Product has worked pefect.... unfortunately my 15month old is officially to big for it now but for the 5 or 6 months i used it , it was perfect. Had no problem with mold as i saw in other comments.... just take time to wash it once a month and i would recommend taking it out after every use and turn them sideways in all directions to drain the excess water in it and it will stay mold free for sure.... did not have to worry about my child slippin and falling in tub and helped him learn to sit in the tub..... was worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Vera

customer_reviews.title: Back piece is long but very sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: This seat is great, I just wish the back piece came off for better placement. Or was shorter. I have a two year old and a 9 month old, so I bathe them together. The seat puts him right before the middle of the tub so it takes up quite a bit of space, BUT I don’t have to worry about it coming undone that’s for sure. My 9 month old loves bath time now that I’m not just trying to hold him. This was a great buy for me.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah W

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Even in a claw foot tub!
customer_reviews.text: We love this little bath seat! We have a claw foot tub and we couldn’t get the back brace up against the back Of the tub due to the angle and we were worried we would have to send it back but the two side suction braces are incredibly strong!! We have been using this for 3 months now and it’s perfect! We do have to put a towel behind our 8 month old to help prop her up but that’s no biggie to us, she loves sitting up and I love knowing she isn’t going to slide under the water! Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: CountryMama

customer_reviews.title: Good transition seat
customer_reviews.text: We used this seat once our baby started sitting up on his own but was still unable to sit unassisted in water. He outgrew his other bath seat and this was perfect for making the transition. That being said I feel like we probably only used it a month or two before he was no longer content to sit in it. Now we just put less water in the tub and let him sit on his own to splash and crawl around. My only complaint is that you have to remove it from the tub frequently to clean it because it gets moldy very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: A must have for babies 4 months +
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know how I lived without this with my first? From the second I started using this product I could finally take a breather without constantly having to hold my baby up. He has been using it since 4 months old and is now 13 months old and still uses it everyday, he loves it so much. He can easily reach for his toys and play, without me having to worry about him slipping! This would be a great shower gift!!! I would and do highly recommend it to all new mamas
customer_reviews.author: MCMD410

customer_reviews.title: I like it a lot.
customer_reviews.text: Kiddlett is 7 months old, and grabbing at the tub handles. Always worried that he is going to turn the hot water on , and burn himself. This seat allowed me to set the seat into position, well back in the tub, and keeps the handle out of his reach. Also, he cannot get his face near the water.... I forgot his bath towel the other morning, and was able to walk to the door and get it without him tipping over, which I NEVER would have done in the other baby tub
customer_reviews.author: Karen Miller

customer_reviews.title: Fits even large garden tubs too! Best bath seat!
customer_reviews.text: I got this bathseat for my 6 month old who already sits up. This is my 3rd kid and by far the best bathseat we've ever owned. My tub is a large garden tub so the side sections are too short so I don't use them but the back suction is so strong it doesn't matter. It is very sturdy, doesn't even float around when she isn't in it despite only using the back suction cup. Takes up less room that the standard reclining baby seats too.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Carter

customer_reviews.title: It’s a love hate relationship with this.
customer_reviews.text: My son is 90% taller than most babies his age but still this seat is too big for him. It’s slippery and the opening from the arm rest to the seat is just big enough for him to get his leg stuck. I get in the tub with him now just to make sure I can hold him while bathing him. They need to make it so that the front is adjustable for different sized babies. He likes to hold onto the crossbar on the front but it leaves a huge amount of space behind him which gives room for him to slip back.
customer_reviews.author: Crissie Freise

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so my 6 month old could baths with his older brother. It allows him to safely have some freedom to play. He’s been using this for almost 2 months and has enjoyed bath times. Things to note of purchasing—it is kind of big to store while not in use. You may want to had something soft to the back if your baby isn’t super stable at sitting because the back is hard could be painful with a big wobble.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Mann

customer_reviews.title: A great purchase!!
customer_reviews.text: We love this seat. Our seven-month-old was a bit too big to be bathed in the kitchen sink but not big enough that we felt comfortable putting her in the bathtub without some support. This seat works great! It's easy to install and remove. It keeps her from tipping in any direction but she's able to shift/twist a little while seated in it to grab toys that float passed her. It's a great seat!
customer_reviews.author: Lefty22

customer_reviews.title: Great for babies that can’t sit by themselves in tub
customer_reviews.text: Love this seat for my baby! She got too big for her baby bathtub and this is the perfect solution until she is steady enough to sit solo in the tub. Water seems to get trapped in the seat because when turned upside down after a bath it will pour out but this doesn’t seem to be an issue other than making a mess on the floor when I take it out of the tub.
customer_reviews.author: Mikayla L

customer_reviews.title: Best baby product ever!
customer_reviews.text: This is seriously one of the best baby products I've ever bought. My son LOVES the water so we use this is the bath but also in the baby pool. He likes being able to sit up by himself and hit the water. He seems very comfortable in it. And I enjoy being able to sit with him and watch him play and not worry about him falling over in the water. Wish I would have had this 11 years ago with my first baby.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Pitre

customer_reviews.title: Must have!
customer_reviews.text: Best. Invention. Ever! This is the best thing for baby bath time! It is super easy to put in the tub and easy to travel with, if needed. My little guy does so we'll being able to sit up in the tub with this. Bath time is so simple!! Your baby does need to be able to sit up unassisted to use it. It is not a snug fit. I have peace of mind knowing that he cannot fall over into the water.
customer_reviews.author: ABB

customer_reviews.title: Leg space too small.
customer_reviews.text: The leg space is very small. My baby is 5 months and it was hard to get her in and out of it due to small leg space. She is not even a big baby! I did not think it would work for more than a month more. so it would not work for me. suction is good and it felt secured in the tub. but definately not comfortable because the front rod is too fat and does not come out. might as well buy a plastic seater and give a bath...not much different than that! plus those are cheaper!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good luck getting their legs in it
customer_reviews.text: Want your baby to throw a tantrum? Buy this seat and try to get their legs into it. An absolutely awful design that makes bath time frustrating when it should be a fun part of baby’s routine. After 3 straight nights of attempting to get my sons legs into this seat, my wife and I are throwing this in the trash and looking for another option. Trust me, look elsewhere!
customer_reviews.author: Chris W.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Sitters
customer_reviews.text: This roomy little seat is a perfect and easy to use bathtime helper to keep your little one from slumping down into the bath water. It installs and removes quickly and easily, and the suction cup stabilizers are super strong on a smooth surface. Be warned though, if your little one can extricate him- or herself from a Bumbo or other seat, they'll be able to easily get out of this one too.
customer_reviews.author: Michael C. Plowden

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Love this seat. We have a fiberglass tub so the suction cups don't really work but because it screws into place it never moves. Only issue is it gets really gross really fast under it so I suggest removing it to fully dry after each use or doing a deep clean probably once a week. But my son thinks it's awesome and it's hard to get him out of the tub now. I'll use this until he's fully stable without it.
customer_reviews.author: AB7105

customer_reviews.title: Unnecessary!!
customer_reviews.text: Returned mine! Pros: Durable, very sturdy. I haven’t used it but seemed very easy to install Cons: I thought it would be helpful to have one but after receiving and thinking about it, I think it’s VERY unnecessary. I have a girl, so I know it would be really hard to wash “that” part of her. So you should shop around and think about it carefully before purchasing;)
customer_reviews.author: Koko

customer_reviews.title: Takes Up More Then Half the Tub
customer_reviews.text: Takes up more then half my tub and twisting the suction cups into place every time would’ve been a total pain. I already have my hands full with a toddler and a baby in the tub. I ended up using the Keter Bath Seat and I am so happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Fan

customer_reviews.title: Holds firm, perfect size, but consider the shape of your tub before buying
customer_reviews.text: This works well for our 7 month old. My only small issue is that it's difficult to install in our tub because it has a slight curved shape on the sides so the suction cups don't sit flat. I wish they could be adjusted differently so that they could adhere to different tub shapes. Something to keep in mind if you don't have just a straight sided bathtub.
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: Love this bath chair
customer_reviews.text: Love this bath chair! Great for when baby starts to learn to sit up on their own. Secures tightly to the tub with no movement. My baby was so comfortable, except seat it a little big so baby kept slipping down some. But I love it and so does baby!
customer_reviews.author: Tricia

customer_reviews.title: No Thanks!
customer_reviews.text: I’m not sure what’s going on with all these rave reviews. This seat allows you to put about 2 inches of water in the tub and I don’t know how on earth you would be able to bathe your baby in it. This is my third child, so was hoping it work work to bathe my baby with his siblings, but there is no way.
customer_reviews.author: Shanna Sturgell

customer_reviews.title: Worth it for a squirmy baby
customer_reviews.text: My son is a wiggler. We used the standard plastic tub until he was 5 months old, but every bath time was a struggle. He flailed, turned, and generally did his best to drown himself. I couldn't let go even to grab a washcloth. With this chair, he can sit upright and wiggle all he wants, and his head stays above water. It makes bath time fun again!
customer_reviews.author: Sylvia Pellicore

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. My son is 7 months old about 18-20 lbs and he loves it since now he can sit and play with the water. It has enough space so he won’t be too tight. It is slippery so if your baby can’t sit up on their own completely you might want to put a towel under. The seat stays in place once I set it up and it is easy to remove!
customer_reviews.author: Lourdes Mata

customer_reviews.title: Ill-conceived product
customer_reviews.text: We tried this for our 6mo baby but it’s hard to get him and out of and you can’t reach it easily enough to actually wash him. Plus, while the side suction cup arms are adjustable, the rear one has a fixed length and it’s so long, the chair is pushed into the center of the bath for no good reason and it consumes all the space our second, older child could have bathed in. I don’t know why anyone would use this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Cramer

customer_reviews.title: A really cute, fun way to give a baby a bath!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter only used it for a few months before taking to water like a fish, but I used this everytime she got a bath. It was very cute, it kept her comfortable, giving her enough room to move her legs and not hold her in place, but was secured to the bath really well. It has a wide open bottom to clean easily. I think it's just a really nice product. Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Tono Makai

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: I love this bath seat. I bought it when my son was around 5 months and not sitting all the way up unassisted. It works perfect, and now I don't have to worry about him trying to escape his baby bath! It does take a lot of space up in a bathtub but that doesn't bother me! It also can be a little hard getting the baby in and out of the seat.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Look no further
customer_reviews.text: My son was absolutely MISERABLE in the tub. He would thrash around and i spent more time holding him up from going under than it took to bath him. My arms got tired and my back was killing me. This seat solved ALL my problems. It holds him up and theres plenty of room to wash him. Set up is a breeze. It even helped him acclimate to the water and he loves bath time now.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Arki

customer_reviews.title: The product works best as intended however I have used it in my ...
customer_reviews.text: It is exactly as described. My child is 4 months and I’m able to wash him well. He loves the freedom to sit up and play. The product works best as intended however I have used it in my large oval master bath by suctioning 2 of the 3 arms and then just remaining close for safety. The back arm has to be fully extended - this unfortunately takes up a ton of bath space making it difficult to have infant with you or an older sibling in the bath as well. Overall worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: This is a monster of a chair. The baby was afraid of it. I had a simple suction bottomed seat with a rim around for baby when I had mine. It was quite safe because I never left baby unattended, nor did I have a cell phone to distract me from being with my babies at bath time. This monstrosity is too bulky. Don't buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Chubby legs, stay away
customer_reviews.text: Just on here to say the same things others have said. My son sat back and got his leg stuck in the hole under the arm portion. It took me a long time and a lot of discomfort on his part to get him out. Also even in normal sitting position the bar over the legs have left marks. If you have skinny babies then it should work fine, if you have a chubby baby... I’d try to find something else.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Nichole

customer_reviews.title: Good seat but don’t get the cheaper one from the warehouse
customer_reviews.text: I really like this bath seat, my reason for the lower review though it that mine arrived very beat up and one of the suction cups is torn of the product. Now while it still works, I’m disappointed that I received what looks like a very worn seat. Even the paint is faded off in areas.
customer_reviews.author: Cadwallader

customer_reviews.title: Great seat
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great seat and super safe if your baby is sitting with no assistance. I wish the back support arm would come off because honestly we don’t use any of them and that one is pretty long. The seat has suction on the bottom that holds the seat tight to the bath tub. I bathe my three-year-old son and my seven month old at the same time and this seat works great.
customer_reviews.author: brittany houghtaling

customer_reviews.title: WONDERFUL!
customer_reviews.text: I read nothing but good reviews on this in my mommy groups. Little man loves baths & I hated holding him. So I finally buckled & got one. So glad I did! He loves being able to site up & play in the tub & I love not having to worry about him slipping. It's easy to use, but definitely takes up room while not in use. I lift it up on its side to dry & then store it in a closet until ready to use again. I have recommended this to so many friends & other moms on Facebook & Instagram as well. WONDERFUL!
customer_reviews.author: Shelley

customer_reviews.title: Does the job but needs some tweaking
customer_reviews.text: We bought two of these for our twins. We love the fact that the swim sets both fit in the tub and they are safe. They are pretty time consuming to install and you do need to take them out after every few baths to remove any build up or mold. Overall we enjoy the product however we wish that the back bar of the seat had padding and a way to be removed once the child is old enough to be stable without it but not old enough to be without a bath seat.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Conrad

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, but flawed design
customer_reviews.text: The seat itself is genius, but there are design flaws. The back suction cup goes out so far that it ended up taking over 2/3 of my tub, which sorta negated the point for me. Also, the side holes are exactly at the height for a baby to stick their arm through and get stuck, and are not dull when you go to pull them out.
customer_reviews.author: Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Not for chunky babies
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited for this product. My 6th month old isn't quite ready to sit up himself and needs some assistance. However the leg holes are TINY! his chunky legs do NOT fit. So if you have a chunk baby, this product is not for you.
customer_reviews.author: Marc Navy

customer_reviews.title: Game changer for two in the tub.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this item! We use it for my second daughter who takes baths with her 3.5 yr old sister. Without a seat like this she wouldn’t be able to share a bath, she’s too unsteady at 6 months and the toddler is too chaotic. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: peapod622

customer_reviews.title: The suction is the best
customer_reviews.text: So I really do love this product but it gets mold in it if you do not get it out of the tub after every use which is a pain when you also have a crazy 4 year old running around. The suction is great if you have a standard tub, but I wish it would go bigger so I can sit in the big tub with my 6 month old. Wish it had a soft bottom for babys butt as that makes him want to get out faster when he loves the water
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Whitehead-Hall

customer_reviews.title: Love it, hate it
customer_reviews.text: This product works well for my 5 month old, it's just kind of hard to get her out of. I wish you could lift up the front of it to get baby out easier. And the back post/ suction cups seemed pointless. We used a screwdriver and removed it and it worked perfectly fine with just the 2 side suction cups.
customer_reviews.author: Keli ludeman

customer_reviews.title: Great concept...but mold isn't cool
customer_reviews.text: Having to bathe 2 babes under 2 years old, this seat is God-send... until you realize that the space behind the 2 side sunction cups don't properly drain creating a mold sanctuary. The back suction cup is far enough away from the seat that it has not issue. Why they wouldn't create all equal is beyond me but it definitely gives this seat a BIG thumbs down from me!
customer_reviews.author: AB Tay

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for young siblings!
customer_reviews.text: I don't remember seeing anything quite like this when my son was a baby, but I'm SO GLAD I have it this go around. It turned bath time into a blast for both of them. ❤️ The way it's designed, you don't need the seat to be on the bottom of the tub. So I can have the water as high as my oldest likes, and it's not too high for my littlest. Just be sure to keep the seat part clean, or else it can get slick because of the soapy water.
customer_reviews.author: BethFolkes

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: Super helpful for a wiggly baby at bath time! I honestly don’t know how my parents ever bathed us kids without one. The baby can sit up and lean over the edges without toppling over. I’ve tried sticking her in the bathtub without the chair and she just slips over or tries to crawl around with her face in the water. I like this sucker. It’s rather large tho. Definitely could only fit one kid at a time in our soaker tub
customer_reviews.author: Jaimie B.

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: This seat is so durable and sturdy. Allows the baby to sit and will not tip over. Makes bath time a breeze and allows you to freely wash the baby while she plays with little bath toys. THIS IS A MUST and so safe. Have nothing but good things to say about the seat.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Neff

customer_reviews.title: Not convenient
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love this bath seat but it was too low in my tub. I couldnt reach my baby to wash his hair or body. It is also very inconvenient if someone else will be using the bath tub. Suction is not bad but i wouldnt recommend it for active babies.
customer_reviews.author: BQ

customer_reviews.title: Excellent & Safe
customer_reviews.text: My baby boy LOVES this seat! He can play with his toys and reach his toys in the bathtub easily - we don't have to worry about the seat moving because the arms attach to the walls and create a very safe and sturdy environment. It's easy to get him in and out and he sits comfortably with plenty of room for growing (he's 8 months old and about 22 pounds). It also allows us to give him a little bit more water to play in versus him sitting in the tub without a seat. & we always keep eyes on him, but this seat gives us ease knowing he's safe!
customer_reviews.author: MTPEV

customer_reviews.title: So glad we bought this!
customer_reviews.text: This bath seat is awesome! Easy to put in and take out, even with one hand while holding baby! Cleans up very well and allows baby to hang out in the tub with a sibling. It does take up quite a bit of space because of the back suction cup arm but there is still enough room for a sibling.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan L.

customer_reviews.title: I like it.
customer_reviews.text: Working out well for us. A little tough to get baby into at first since she straightens her legs when I go to put her in but otherwise, I how easy it is to use. The one con is that you’ve got to be diligent about cleaning the suction cups and they aren’t exactly meant to be removed. I clean the seat and tub everyday but when I pulled up the seat and the suction cup was stuck, I found some mold. It was easily cleaned but it’s an extra step to really get it clean. I’m allergic to mold and a little crazy about cleaning so there’s that.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: My baby loves the bath and this seat allows her to enjoy her bath time while also being safe. This seat is super sturdy and easy to take in and out of the tub. Sometimes water gets in the middle of the seat and is hard to dry, but other than that no complains!
customer_reviews.author: Stacy Myszka

customer_reviews.title: Great product and very reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: This item is great!! Our daughter is now a year and ready to start taking a bath without the chair but it has been a lifesaver as I was healing from a back injury and needed to keep her safe in the tub without climbing all over and falling. I would keep her in it forever if her legs were t getting too long for it. Great product!!
customer_reviews.author: Amy T Thornotn

customer_reviews.title: Would not buy again
customer_reviews.text: I bought this seat for my son. I'm giving it a 3 because I felt there were several factors not considered like boys with soap sliding forward to the leg divider and squishing their little boy parts, soapy water causing the baby to slide forward, and no easy way to wash bottom other than standing up and having baby slip. Side suction works great but the back suction does nothing.
customer_reviews.author: TM

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Just bought this for my almost seven month old who was wiggling and turning to much in his baby bath, even in the sitting position and it was floating when we’d add water to the big tub so he could bathe w his brother. This seat, is AMAZING. He is contained, but supported and can move but.l not tip over. Worth the piece of mind. And he fits easily w his brother in the tub. Probably takes up the same amount of space as the baby tub was anyways!
customer_reviews.author: Happy

customer_reviews.title: Takes the fear out of the bath!
customer_reviews.text: I feel so much safer about my 8 month old in the tub with this seat. He is still able to move around some and play, but it stops him from leaning into the water to try to put his mouth on toys (currently teething). It isn't the most convenient since I shower in the same tub, but you can push in the back bar to store a bit more compact.
customer_reviews.author: CaitlinLDOKC

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, baby loves the freedom
customer_reviews.text: My son is a giant and was starting to get a little big for the standard baby tub. I can’t find these ring seats in store so happy to find an open box deal on amazon, it was my first time doing it and so happy I did. This bath seat is perfect and easy to use. He loves being a little more free (and he’s safe). Definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Son loves it
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this seat. It is hard to get him into it because he is kicking so much due to his excitement. He banged his head on the hump located on the back support but if it wasn’t there he would flip backward. Maybe a bumper could be added on the next model? Drains fairly quickly, suction power is high, and roomy enough to clean up the kid!
customer_reviews.author: Ed Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Suctions very well
customer_reviews.text: Our son has some motor delays and this is perfect to help with bath time. Sturdy and suction cups work very well. He's still able to reach for the water and toys but this keeps his seated so he doesn't fall over. Absolutely worth the money for us.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Hubbard

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Seat
customer_reviews.text: This is a great seat to transition infants out of the baby bath while still giving some stability in the tub. The seat is durable, the suction cups and pressure mounts are super solid. There isn't any drainage from the seat, so if you fill the tub above the seat's max fill level you have to uninstall the seat after each bath to dry out. We only used this seat for a month, but it was helpful to have during the transition time.
customer_reviews.author: McDermom

customer_reviews.title: Not returning but wouldn't necessarily recommend
customer_reviews.text: PRO: - Once stuck it doesn't come loose. - very safe and keeps baby's face away from water - easy to install CON: - hard to pull kid out due to legs out in front - nearly impossible to wash their "undercarriage" - safety sticker ugly/large and unable to be removed -instructions say to stop using once they are able to pull up... so between needing the neck support and begin to pull up that is seemingly very few months of use.
customer_reviews.author: Lunn

customer_reviews.title: No more standing in the bath!
customer_reviews.text: My son is notorious for standing up in the bath tub. It’s super slippery and I had to constantly hold him up which strains my back. This seat is a LIFE SAVER! He doesn’t try to get out of the seat and it makes bath time enjoyable for both of us. The suction cups are so strong. I tried pulling on the seat when there was no water in the tub and there was no movement.. and I pulled hard! Don’t waste any more time! Buy this bath seat!
customer_reviews.author: Dalton D.

customer_reviews.title: Powerful suction, secure
customer_reviews.text: We couldn't believe how wel the suction cups stick to the bath tub and are super secure! My 5 month old loves this seat and can still reach bath toys. Easy to wash baby because there's room around him in the seat. The chair is easy to clean and directions are easy to follow.
customer_reviews.author: 4dogdesigns

customer_reviews.title: Very safe!
customer_reviews.text: This has been a total game-changer for us! I used to try and sneak in a shower during nap time, but without fail, the baby would wake up and cry. Now, I just bring her into the shower with me and she safely plays while I get a few minutes to relax.
customer_reviews.author: Luca's Mom

customer_reviews.title: I can safely and comfortably bathe both my boys at the same time and ...
customer_reviews.text: Very please with this seat. I can safely and comfortably bathe both my boys at the same time and I couldn't be happier. My younger son who uses the seat has been using it since he waz about 4.5 months and is almost 7 mo now and I'll continue to use it as long as he keeps going in without any complaints :)
customer_reviews.author: Bbaker27

customer_reviews.title: Totally worth it!!
customer_reviews.text: This is incredible. I fought against buying it because I thought, oh, it's a bit expensive for such a short period of time -- but my partner bought it so I'd stop waffling and I LOVE IT. Bath time is so easy and it's a fantastic opportunity for my toddler and baby to continue to bond.
customer_reviews.author: EmTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Great for safe fun bathtime.
customer_reviews.text: My son likes to kick and splash in the tub. This helps keep him safe while bathing him(he won't sit still so I worry about him hitting his head). Easy to install in a standard bathtub. It is a little bulky, but well worth it to make sure baby is safe and happy in the tub!
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Hard plastic seat, but great idea!
customer_reviews.text: The seat is a great idea. It sits very securely in the tub. The only problem with it is that it's made of a really hard plastic material. It needs some seat padding because it seems very uncomfortable for baby to sit in. I usually just set something in the bottom of it. It's a great idea overall but it needs some upgrading.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Baier

customer_reviews.title: Safe....
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my nephew. I was looking for a bath seat that suctioned cupped to the bottom of the tub. Apparently, they do not make those any longer. While he loves being able to sit up and play while having his tubby, it is a bit of work to set this thing up. It also takes up a decent amount of space for storing it.
customer_reviews.author: Genevieve

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Started using this once my baby started sitting up good around 5/6 months. He’s almost 8 months now and it still works great. No issues with sturdiness. It doesn’t budge. It’s a little bulky (as we bath our toddler with him at the same time) but it’s ok for now.
customer_reviews.author: brianna411

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Was so nice to see our daughter no longer having to hold the baby in the tub but sitting beside it while she was in this seat. I can not say enough good about this safety seat it was a great investment thank you . 5 Stars *****
customer_reviews.author: Elle

customer_reviews.title: Buy the activity seat for the same use.
customer_reviews.text: The bath seat is a great idea but if your baby is 7 months old or close to it like mine and already sitting on her own.. Add water and soap to the mix and your baby flops around in it.. I put a towel under her to help a bit but the seat itself is way to big.. I bought the summer infant seat with the activity table that goes all the way around it and comes off to just be a seat and now I use it instead.. Much better investment.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa

customer_reviews.title: Bulky but works for what it was intended to.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Feels safe to put toddler in i.e. sturdy Allows for baby/toddler to play independently Encourages core development Cons: A little bulky and takes up a lot of tub space.
customer_reviews.author: Sirius

customer_reviews.title: go in the tub and be instantly happy and smiling but she cried in this
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is transitioning from the Angelcare tub. She can't splash or play well in this tub, it's very restrictive. We have only used it once. My daughter can be extremely grumpy, go in the tub and be instantly happy and smiling but she cried in this. She couldn't reach any of the water and the way it's made, her feet couldn't splash either.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren D

customer_reviews.title: Awesome but short useful life
customer_reviews.text: This bath seat is great, BUT be prepared to only be able to use it for a few months. Once your babe starts to explore, it's easy to get caught up and potentially hurt so you have to retire it. It was wicked convenient when we could use it, and I didn't have any issues with cleaning it.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

product_meta.title: Summer My Bath Seat, Baby Bathtub Seat for Sit-Up Bathing with Backrest Support and Suction Cups for Stability
product_meta.description: Color:AquaThe My Bath Seat provides a helping hand to parents and full support to baby during bath time. A high back rest comfortably supports baby while three sturdy arms lock in place with suction cups, all helping to keep your 5-10 month old securely in place in the bath. Never use product in a sink, non-rectangular tub, oval, Jacuzzi or whirlpool style tub, or any tub that has water jet nozzles
feature_bullets: Fits in standard rectangular tubs 21-24 inches wide
Provides hands free support for your baby during bath time
Bath Seat secures to tub with locking suction cups for stability and safety
